intro: Ilyogeton subulatum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in complex structures called cyathia. Ilyogeton subulatum is often found in open vegetation types and is relatively drought-tolerant.
